   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Some gen_tcp-specific tests demonstrating problems that were
   23: %% encountered during diameter development but have nothing
   24: %% specifically to do with diameter. These can cause testcases in
   25: %% other suites to fail.
   26: %%
   27: 
   28: -module(diameter_gen_tcp_SUITE).
   29: 
   30: %% testcases, not common_test dependency
   31: -export([run/0,
   32:          run/1]).
   33: 
   34: %% common_test wrapping
   35: -export([suite/0,
   36:          all/0,
   37:          send_long/1,
   38:          connect/1]).
   39: 
   40: -define(LOOPBACK, {127,0,0,1}).
   41: -define(GEN_OPTS, [binary, {active, true}, {ip, ?LOOPBACK}]).
   42: 
   43: %% ===========================================================================
   44: 
   45: suite() ->
   46:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 10}}].
   47: 
   48: all() ->
   49:     [connect,     %% Appears to fail only when run first.
   50:      send_long].
   51: 
   52: send_long(_) ->
   53:     send_long().
   54: 
   55: connect(_) ->
   56:     connect().
   57: 
   58: %% ===========================================================================
   59: 
   60: %% run/0
   61: 
   62: run() ->
   63:     run(all()).
   64: 
   65: %% run/1
   66: 
   67: run(List) ->
   68:     diameter_util:run([{{?MODULE, F, [[]]}, 10000} || F <- List]).
   69: 
   70: %% send_long/0
   71: %%
   72: %% Test that a long message is received.
   73: 
   74: send_long() ->
   75:     {Sock, SendF} = connection(),
   76:     B = binary:copy(<<$X>>, 1 bsl 20),
   77:     ok = SendF(B),
   78:     B = recv(Sock, byte_size(B), []).
   79: 
   80: recv(_, 0, Acc) ->
   81:     list_to_binary(lists:reverse(Acc));
   82: recv(Sock, N, Acc) ->
   83:     receive
   84:         {tcp, Sock, Bin} ->
   85:             recv(Sock, N - byte_size(Bin), [Bin | Acc]);
   86:         T ->
   87:             {T, Acc}
   88:     end.
   89: 
   90: %% connection/0
   91: 
   92: connection() ->
   93:     {ok, LSock} = gen_tcp:listen(0, ?GEN_OPTS),
   94:     {ok, PortNr} = inet:port(LSock),
   95:     LPid = self(),
   96:     {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> connect(PortNr, LPid) end),
   97:     {ok, Sock} = gen_tcp:accept(LSock),
   98:     receive
   99:         {Pid, F} ->
  100:             {Sock, F};
  101:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, _, _} = T ->
  102:             T
  103:     end.
  104: 
  105: %% connect/2
  106: 
  107: connect(PortNr, LPid) ->
  108:     {ok, Sock} = gen_tcp:connect(?LOOPBACK, PortNr, ?GEN_OPTS),
  109:     LPid ! {self(), fun(B) -> send(Sock, B) end},
  110:     down(LPid).
  111: 
  112: %% send/2
  113: %%
  114: %% Send from a spawned process just to avoid sending from the
  115: %% receiving process, in case it's significant.
  116: 
  117: send(Sock, Bin) ->
  118:     {_, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> exit(gen_tcp:send(Sock, Bin)) end),
  119:     down(MRef).
  120: 
  121: %% ===========================================================================
  122: 
  123: %% connect/0
  124: %%
  125: %% Test that simultaneous connections succeed. This fails sporadically
  126: %% on OS X at the time of writing, when gen_tcp:connect/2 returns
  127: %% {error, econnreset}.
  128: 
  129: connect() ->
  130:     {ok, LSock} = gen_tcp:listen(0, ?GEN_OPTS),
  131:     {ok, {_,PortNr}} = inet:sockname(LSock),
  132:     Count = lists:seq(1,8),  %% 8 simultaneous connects
  133:     As = [gen_accept(LSock) || _ <- Count],
  134:     %% Wait for spawned processes to have called gen_tcp:accept/1
  135:     %% (presumably).
  136:     receive after 2000 -> ok end,
  137:     Cs = [gen_connect(PortNr) || _ <- Count],
  138:     [] = failures(Cs),
  139:     [] = failures(As).
  140: 
  141: failures(Monitors) ->
  142:     [RC || {_, MRef} <- Monitors, RC <- [down(MRef)], ok /= element(1, RC)].
  143: 
  144: gen_accept(LSock) ->
  145:     spawn_monitor(fun() ->
  146:                           exit(gen_tcp:accept(LSock))
  147:                   end).
  148: 
  149: gen_connect(PortNr) ->
  150:     spawn_monitor(fun() ->
  151:                           exit(gen_tcp:connect(?LOOPBACK, PortNr, ?GEN_OPTS))
  152:                   end).
  153: 
  154: %% ===========================================================================
  155: 
  156: %% down/1
  157: 
  158: down(Pid)
  159:   when is_pid(Pid) ->
  160:     down(monitor(process, Pid));
  161: 
  162: down(MRef) ->
  163:     receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, _, Reason} -> Reason end.
